org.apache.karaf.shell.api.console

Interface SessionFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SecuredSessionFactoryImpl, SessionFactoryImpl

    public interface SessionFactory
    The SessionFactory can be used to create Session to execute commands. The Registry associated with this SessionFactory will contain:
    • SessionFactory
    • Registry
    • Commands

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Session create(java.io.InputStream in, java.io.PrintStream out, java.io.PrintStream err)
      Create a new headless session.
      Session create(java.io.InputStream in, java.io.PrintStream out, java.io.PrintStream err, Session session)
      Create a new headless session inheriting from the parent session.
      Session create(java.io.InputStream in, java.io.PrintStream out, java.io.PrintStream err, Terminal term, java.lang.String encoding, java.lang.Runnable closeCallback)
      Create new interactive session.
      Registry getRegistry()
      Retrieve the Registry used by this SessionFactory.

    • Method Detail

      • getRegistry

        Registry getRegistry()
        Retrieve the Registry used by this SessionFactory.
        Returns:
        a registry built by the factory.

      • create

        Session create(java.io.InputStream in,
               java.io.PrintStream out,
               java.io.PrintStream err,
               Terminal term,
               java.lang.String encoding,
               java.lang.Runnable closeCallback)
        Create new interactive session.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream, can be null if the session is only used to execute a command using Session.execute(CharSequence)
        out - the output stream
        err - the error stream
        term - the Terminal to use, may be null
        encoding - the encoding to use for the input stream, may be null
        closeCallback - a callback to be called when the session is closed, may be null
        Returns:
        the new session

      • create

        Session create(java.io.InputStream in,
               java.io.PrintStream out,
               java.io.PrintStream err)
        Create a new headless session. Headless session can only be used to execute commands, so that Runnable.run() can not be used.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream, can be null if the session is only used to execute a command using Session.execute(CharSequence)
        out - the output stream
        err - the error stream
        Returns:
        the new session

      • create

        Session create(java.io.InputStream in,
               java.io.PrintStream out,
               java.io.PrintStream err,
               Session session)
        Create a new headless session inheriting from the parent session. Headless session can only be used to execute commands, so that Runnable.run() can not be used. All variables and the terminal properties from the parent session will be available.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream, can be null if the session is only used to execute a command using Session.execute(CharSequence)
        out - the output stream
        err - the error stream
        session - the parent session
        Returns:
        the new session
